alert.note: Alert for Graham (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 2:53PM MST until July 30 at 5:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following counties, Cochise and Graham. * WHEN...Until 345 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 253 PM MST, The heaviest rainfall had ended in the advisory area but runoff problems will likely continue through at least 345 PM MST this afternoon. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... near Willcox, mainly east of there. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
